subject: polity
title: Lok Sabha vs Rajya Sabha - Comprehensive Comparison
description: Complete comparison of India's two houses of Parliament covering constitutional provisions, composition, powers, procedures, and exam-relevant exceptional points

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Art 80**: Council of States
**Upper House** of Parliament
Represents **States** (Federal character)
rows.lok_sabha:
**Art 81**: House of the People
**Lower House** of Parliament
Represents **People** (Popular sovereignty)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Permanent body** - Never dissolves
**1/3rd members retire** every 2 years
Continuous existence since 1952
rows.lok_sabha:
**Temporary body** - Dissolves after 5 years
**Entire House** dissolves at once
Can be dissolved before 5 years by President

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Maximum 250 members**
Currently **245 members**
• 233 elected (States & UTs)
• 12 nominated by President
rows.lok_sabha:
**Maximum 552 members**
Currently **543 members**
• 530 from States
• 13 from Union Territories
• 2 Anglo-Indians (Lapsed after 104th Amendment 2020)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Indirect election** by State Legislative Assemblies
**STV (Single Transferable Vote)** - Proportional representation
Members represent their State
rows.lok_sabha:
**Direct election** by people of India
**FPTP (First Past The Post)** system
Members represent their constituency

rows.rajya_sabha:
**6 years** term for each member
1/3rd (82 members approx) retire every 2 years
Member can be re-elected indefinitely
rows.lok_sabha:
**5 years** normal term
Can be dissolved earlier (no-confidence, PM's advice)
**Emergency**: Extended by 1 year at a time (max 1 year after Emergency ends - Art 83(2))

rows.rajya_sabha:
Based on **population** of State
**UP 31** (highest), Maharashtra 19, Tamil Nadu 18
**Sikkim 1** (lowest)
States with <4 population get 1 seat
rows.lok_sabha:
Based on **population** of State
**UP 80** (highest), Maharashtra 48, West Bengal 42, Bihar 40
**Sikkim, Mizoram 1** (lowest)
Reserved seats: 84 SC, 47 ST

rows.rajya_sabha:
**12 members** nominated by President (Art 80(3))
Experts in: **Art, Literature, Science, Social Service**
Example: Sachin Tendulkar, Lata Mangeshkar, Mary Kom
rows.lok_sabha:
**2 Anglo-Indian members** nominated by President (Art 331)
**LAPSED** after 104th Amendment 2020
No nominated members currently

rows.rajya_sabha:
• Indian citizen
• **30+ years** of age
• No office of profit
• Registered voter in any State
rows.lok_sabha:
• Indian citizen
• **25+ years** of age
• No office of profit
• Registered voter in any State

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Chairman**: Vice President of India (Art 64)
**Ex-officio** - NOT a member of RS
Appointed by virtue of being VP
Cannot vote except in tie (casting vote)
rows.lok_sabha:
**Speaker**: Elected from LS members (Art 93)
**IS a member** of LS
Usually from ruling party (convention)
Cannot vote except in tie (casting vote)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Deputy Chairman** (Art 89)
Elected by RS members from amongst themselves
Removable by effective majority of RS
rows.lok_sabha:
**Deputy Speaker** (Art 93)
Elected by LS members from amongst themselves
Usually from opposition (convention)
Removable by effective majority of LS (Art 94)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Deputy Chairman** removable by:
• Resolution of RS
• Effective majority (simple majority of present & voting)
• 14 days notice required
**Chairman (VP)** removed separately as VP
rows.lok_sabha:
**Speaker & Deputy Speaker** removable by:
• Resolution of LS
• Effective majority (simple majority of present & voting)
• **14 days notice** required (Art 94)
Rarely happens in practice

rows.rajya_sabha:
**1/10th of total strength** = 25 members
If no quorum, meeting adjourned
Often misused to stall proceedings
rows.lok_sabha:
**1/10th of total strength** = 55 members
If no quorum, meeting adjourned
Often misused to stall proceedings

rows.rajya_sabha:
Can initiate **any bill EXCEPT Money Bills**
Can delay **Ordinary Bill** by max **6 months**
Can delay **Money Bill** by max **14 days**
Cannot reject Ordinary/Money Bills - LS prevails
rows.lok_sabha:
Can initiate **ANY bill** including Money Bills
**Final authority** on all bills
If bill sent back by RS, LS can pass again
**Joint Sitting** called if deadlock - LS dominates (543 vs 245)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Cannot initiate** Money Bills
Can **recommend amendments** (not binding)
**14 days** to return with recommendations
If not returned in 14 days, deemed passed
**No veto power**
rows.lok_sabha:
**Exclusive power** to originate Money Bills
**Final authority** on Money Bills
Can accept/reject RS recommendations
**Speaker's certificate** on Money Bill is final (Art 110(3))
RS cannot delay beyond 14 days

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Financial Bill Type I**: Same as Money Bill (14 days)
**Financial Bill Type II**: Like Ordinary Bill (6 months delay)
Cannot increase/reduce taxation/expenditure proposals
rows.lok_sabha:
**Financial Bill Type I**: Originates only in LS
**Financial Bill Type II**: Originates only in LS
**Full control** over financial legislation
RS has limited say

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Cannot vote** on Budget
**Cannot vote** on Demands for Grants (Art 113)
Can **discuss** budget in General Discussion
**No control** over government expenditure
rows.lok_sabha:
**Exclusive power** to vote on Budget
Votes on **Demands for Grants** (Art 113)
Can **reduce/reject** but **NOT increase** demand (Art 113(3))
**Cut Motions**: Policy (Re 1), Economy (specific), Token (Rs 100)

rows.rajya_sabha:
Can make **recommendations** (14 days)
Cannot reject or amend
LS can accept/reject recommendations
**No control** over withdrawal from Consolidated Fund
rows.lok_sabha:
**Final authority** on Appropriation Bill
Must pass for govt to withdraw money from CFI
**Money Bill** - All Money Bill provisions apply
Cannot be amended (amounts already voted)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**No control** over Council of Ministers
Ministers can be from RS (Max 15% of LS)
Can ask questions, discuss policies
**Cannot move no-confidence** motion
rows.lok_sabha:
**Full control** over Council of Ministers
Council collectively responsible **ONLY to LS** (Art 75(3))
Can move **no-confidence motion** (50 members support)
If passed, govt must resign

rows.rajya_sabha:
**NOT allowed** in RS
Cannot move no-confidence against govt
Can criticize policies but cannot remove govt
rows.lok_sabha:
**Only in LS** (Art 75(3))
Needs support of **50 members** to admit
If passed, **govt must resign**
Most powerful parliamentary tool

rows.rajya_sabha:
**11 AM - 12 PM** (1 hour)
**Starred Questions**: Oral answer + supplementary
**Unstarred Questions**: Written answer
Ministers must answer questions
rows.lok_sabha:
**11 AM - 12 PM** (1 hour)
**Starred Questions**: Oral answer + supplementary
**Unstarred Questions**: Written answer
More impactful due to executive responsibility

rows.rajya_sabha:
**12 PM - 1 PM** (after Question Hour)
**Indian innovation** (started 1962)
**NOT in Constitution/Rules**
Members raise urgent matters without notice
rows.lok_sabha:
**12 PM - 1 PM** (after Question Hour)
**Indian innovation** (started 1962)
**NOT in Constitution/Rules**
Members raise urgent matters without notice

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Adjournment Motion**: Can move (censures govt)
**Censure Motion**: Can move
**No-confidence Motion**: **NOT allowed**
**Cut Motions**: **NOT allowed** (no budget voting)
rows.lok_sabha:
**Adjournment Motion**: Can move (censures govt)
**Censure Motion**: Can move
**No-confidence Motion**: **Only in LS**
**Cut Motions**: **Only in LS** (during Demands for Grants)

rows.rajya_sabha:
Called for **Ordinary/Financial Bills only** (NOT Money Bills)
Presided by **LS Speaker**
RS members: 245
**LS will dominate** due to larger strength
rows.lok_sabha:
Called for **Ordinary/Financial Bills only** (NOT Money Bills)
Presided by **LS Speaker**
LS members: 543
**LS dominates** - More votes than RS

rows.rajya_sabha:
Used only **3 times** in history:
• Dowry Prohibition Act 1960
• Banking Service Commission (Repeal) Act 1978
• Prevention of Terrorism Act (POTA) 2002
rows.lok_sabha:
Used only **3 times** in history:
• Dowry Prohibition Act 1960
• Banking Service Commission (Repeal) Act 1978
• Prevention of Terrorism Act (POTA) 2002

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Art 249**: Authorize Parliament to legislate on **State List** (National interest) - **2/3rd majority** needed
**Art 312**: Create new **All India Service** - **2/3rd majority** needed
**VP Removal**: RS initiates resolution (Art 67b)
rows.lok_sabha:
No exclusive powers similar to Art 249/312
But has **supreme powers** in:
• Money Bills (Art 110)
• No-confidence (Art 75(3))
• Budget & Grants (Art 113-114)

rows.rajya_sabha:
No equivalent powers
Weaker than LS in all financial & executive matters
rows.lok_sabha:
**Money Bills**: Exclusive origination & passage (Art 110)
**No-confidence**: Only LS can remove govt (Art 75(3))
**Budget**: Must be passed by LS
**Demands for Grants**: Only LS votes (Art 113)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**President Election**: RS members vote (along with LS + MLAs)
**Vice President Election**: RS members vote (only MPs, no MLAs)
**Equal power** with LS in President's impeachment (Art 61)
rows.lok_sabha:
**President Election**: LS members vote (along with RS + MLAs)
**Vice President Election**: LS members vote (only MPs, no MLAs)
**Equal power** with RS in President's impeachment (Art 61)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
Can initiate impeachment (1/4th members notice)
Must pass with **2/3rd of total strength**
RS investigation if LS initiates
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
Can initiate impeachment (1/4th members notice)
Must pass with **2/3rd of total strength**
LS investigation if RS initiates

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
Can initiate removal of SC/HC judges
**Special majority** needed: 2/3rd present + Majority of total
Both Houses must pass separately
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
Can initiate removal of SC/HC judges
**Special majority** needed: 2/3rd present + Majority of total
Both Houses must pass separately

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
**Special majority** needed: 2/3rd present & voting + Majority of total strength
Some amendments need 50% State ratification
**Cannot be overruled** by LS
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
**Special majority** needed: 2/3rd present & voting + Majority of total strength
Some amendments need 50% State ratification
**Cannot overrule** RS in amendments

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
Must approve Emergency within 1 month
**Special majority** needed for approval
Can disapprove Emergency proclamation
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
Must approve Emergency within 1 month
**Special majority** needed for approval
**10% members** can demand disapproval vote (44th Amendment)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
Must approve within 2 months
**Simple majority** sufficient
Never used (0 times in history)
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
Must approve within 2 months
**Simple majority** sufficient
Never used (0 times in history)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Equal power** with LS
Must approve within 2 months
**Simple majority** sufficient
Extension beyond 1 year needs both Houses
rows.lok_sabha:
**Equal power** with RS
Must approve within 2 months
**Simple majority** sufficient
Extension beyond 1 year needs both Houses

rows.rajya_sabha:
**3 sessions per year**:
• Budget Session (Feb-May)
• Monsoon Session (July-Aug)
• Winter Session (Nov-Dec)
Summoned by President (Art 85)
rows.lok_sabha:
**3 sessions per year**:
• Budget Session (Feb-May)
• Monsoon Session (July-Aug)
• Winter Session (Nov-Dec)
Summoned by President (Art 85)

rows.rajya_sabha:
President prorogues RS (ends session)
Pending bills **do NOT lapse**
Committee work continues during prorogation
rows.lok_sabha:
President prorogues LS (ends session)
Pending bills **do NOT lapse** (unless LS dissolves)
Committee work continues during prorogation

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Never dissolves** - Permanent body
No concept of dissolution
Continuous existence
rows.lok_sabha:
**All pending bills lapse** (except bills pending in RS)
Speaker & Deputy Speaker vacate office
New elections conducted
New LS constituted within 6 months

rows.rajya_sabha:
Ministers can be from RS
PM usually from LS (not mandatory)
RS ministers must answer questions in RS
Max 15% of LS strength (91st Amendment)
rows.lok_sabha:
Most ministers from LS (convention)
PM must command majority in LS
LS ministers must answer questions in LS
Max 15% of LS strength (91st Amendment)

rows.rajya_sabha:
**Less powerful** than LS
**Cannot**: Reject bills, Control finances, Remove govt
**Can**: Delay bills (6 months max), Special powers (Art 249, 312)
Often called 'Elder House' with mature deliberation
rows.lok_sabha:
**More powerful** than RS
**Supreme** in: Financial matters, Executive control, Legislation
**Real power center** of Indian democracy
Represents popular will

rows.rajya_sabha:
• **NOT equal** to LS (unlike US Senate)
• Represents **federal character**
• **Cannot remove govt** (no no-confidence)
• Exclusive powers: **Art 249** (State List), **Art 312** (All India Services)
• Can delay Ordinary Bill **6 months**, Money Bill **14 days**
rows.lok_sabha:
• **Supreme chamber** in Indian Parliament
• **Real executive** responsible ONLY to LS
• **Money Bills**: Exclusive power (Speaker's certificate final)
• **No-confidence**: Only in LS
• Dominates **Joint Sitting** (543 vs 245)

data.summary: Lok Sabha is MORE POWERFUL than Rajya Sabha. LS has exclusive control over Money Bills (Art 110), Budget & Grants (Art 113-114), and can remove government via no-confidence (Art 75(3)). RS can delay Ordinary Bills (6 months max) and Money Bills (14 days max) but cannot reject them. RS has exclusive powers under Art 249 (authorize Parliament to legislate on State List) and Art 312 (create All India Services). Both Houses have equal power in Constitutional Amendments, President's impeachment, and Emergency provisions. LS (543 members, 5-year term, directly elected) represents people; RS (245 members, 6-year term, indirectly elected) represents states. Key exam point: Despite being Upper House, RS is LESS powerful than LS unlike US Senate.
